title: Social Studies Integrated Learning Design Through Embodied Mathematics

context.prior_knowledge: Basic Mathematical Concepts (Number Recognition, Elementary Arithmetic) and Physical Activity Capability
context.additional_context: Practice space requiring digital devices (tablets, motion sensors), enabling activity-based learning in classrooms or outdoor settings

learning_goals: Learners can explain three or more methods of expressing the magnitude, order, and relationships of numbers through physical movements.
Learners can submit video or written documentation of the process of solving mathematical problems using movement (speed, weight perception, body coordination).
Learners can present mathematical patterns observed in embodied activities by connecting them to social phenomena (e.g., population distribution, resource allocation).

resources: Tablet PC or motion capture device

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
